TopicTitle: New ideas and Concept art, for those who can build it! Write a review!! ;)

Articles.Content: i really like some of these ideas, may i model some?
Really great Concepts but they just don't seem very stocklike to me.

I love the second version of the emergency escape capsule, it looks awesome, I can't wait to start putting that into the mod. I'm determined to get the current models textured first though, I've just finished the explorer cockpit (the yellow one) and I'm planning to start the texture for the triangular pod tonight as long as i don't spend too long getting the explorer working correctly in-game.
Tried modeling one of your sketches to see how it would look(Note this is not a model i spent 2 weeks merely testing your sketch) and if i got the time it could look pretty nice.

i really like some of these ideas, may i model some?

I'd love to see some of these concepts rendered the way you've done your other artwork. Some of the models are already built & textured as a mod that's a work in progress, so if there's any of those that would be useful to you then let me know, and i can send them through to you. here's the thread.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/41700-WIP-PARTS-Random-Parts-Mod

You're kidding? You're into space games and you've never played the original Elite? That's the Cobra Mk III, the main flyable ship from the 80s game, the first one. Of course it appeared in the sequels too, suitably upgraded.
I was too young to play that! lol
Another one of those little mini.... with bigger engines

U-Cabin Mk2

A WORKING PROGRESS.....
I love all of these designs, they look just like what I would expect to see in the mid/late 21st century, or its kerbal equivalent.

Love the WIB vehicle. You don't see many blue ships

As to Elite, yeah I kind of guessed. A lot of people here are younger than me. *Waggles walking cane in the air* Ya young wippersnappers don't know what it's like to land a REAL rocket ship! Why in my day... blah blah blah.

Ahem, well I was just thinking that that ship was sort of iconic to space gamers. Shows what I know? Plus of course from Frontier and the upcoming Elite Dangerous. Well I'm sure there's tons of stuff out there that I don't know about that people can't believe I'm not aware of... mostly sports stuff

Another one of those little mini.... with bigger engines

Damn that looks good

im working on the model here http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/41700-WIP-PARTS-Random-Parts-Mod?p=637619#post637619

Edited September 7, 2013 by Rareden

Love the WIB vehicle. You don't see many blue ships

As to Elite, yeah I kind of guessed. A lot of people here are younger than me. *Waggles walking cane in the air* Ya young wippersnappers don't know what it's like to land a REAL rocket ship! Why in my day... blah blah blah.

Ahem, well I was just thinking that that ship was sort of iconic to space gamers. Shows what I know? Plus of course from Frontier and the upcoming Elite Dangerous. Well I'm sure there's tons of stuff out there that I don't know about that people can't believe I'm not aware of... mostly sports stuff

I've always felt like I /should/ play it, but... the original X games are about as low as I can tolerate in terms of graphical fidelity.

On Topic: I somehow missed this thread. Definitely some cool concepts; I like your style. I may take a crack at a few of them just for practice, see how they turn out.

In that case even Frontier would be a bit low on graphical quality. Though there was that Russian mod to it that did spice the graphics up a lot. Never did try that out. *shrugs* Still, Frontier is a little different from most of those types of game. It's about the only flightsim (barring Orbiter, KSP etc) I know that has true Newtonian physics involved. You don't just fly at a given speed in space, you actually accelerate like a real space ship. Very cool for the time. Even the new Elite Dangerous went back to 'speeds' in space. Very odd, but expected I guess to get more players interested.

-snip-

U-Cabin Mk2

A WORKING PROGRESS.....

LOVE this kind of design. We need some more big meaty Kerbal hab modules, and telescopic non-pushout legs would be cool as well!
"Scorpion Mk2"

Mk2

Just made a quick sketch on another version, though i think this would be more practical looking. and little smaller than the Mk1

Hey Wanner364, nice sketch(Skorpion Mk2) so decided to model front chassi for now until i get your approval of it(ignore those weird shading issues on the back unfinished part, just trying out new rendering)
Yes Definitely Approved!! Wow, Nice work!
Reminds me of the Scifi covers that were made in the seventies. Very cool design.
Tried my own way with the wheels, look fine enough for me and gonna start texturing it and doing unity stuff and all that tedious work so you can enjoy it in-game
Wow! it does look amazing alrealdy!! Thanks!
I seriosuly feel like this post is dead. so....Bump...?

Make it happen. Make it ALL happen!

The sci-fi ships look cool, but I think the blocky utility cabins and the rover look the most awesome.

Wondering what you guys think...

These are my first couple of designs of what kerbals might look like if they had different spacesuits on choose which one you like!

Let's go shopping kerbals!!
